edu.gvsu.dlunit

Class DLUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gvsu.dlunit.DLUnit

  • public class DLUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    The public DLUnit interface: Use these methods to drive the underlying simulator and query its final state.
    Author:
    Joseph Bentley, Zachary Kurmas

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Reset the simulator. The main engine does this after every test. Users need only call this method by hand when running the simulator multiple times within a single JUnit test.

      • testParameters

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> testParameters()
        Get the test parameters. Specifically, return the list of values for the --parameter and --input options entered on the command line.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable List of parameters for the test

      • setPin

        public static void setPin(java.lang.String name,
                          boolean value)
                   throws NoSuchElementException,
                          InvalidElementException,
                          InvalidWidthException
        Set a one-bit input pin. Cannot be used on multi-bit input pins (i.e., buses).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the input pin
        value - the value to be set (true or false).
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no input pin named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - If the input pin does not have width 1.

      • setPinSigned

        public static void setPinSigned(java.lang.String name,
                                long value)
                         throws NoSuchElementException,
                                InvalidElementException,
                                InvalidWidthException
        Set an input bus (multiple pins bundled together as a single unit). When using this method, the input pin must have enough room for a sign bit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the input pin
        value - the value to be set
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no input pin named (key)
        InvalidElementException - If name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - if the input pin is not wide enough (i.e., does not have enough bits) to represent value

      • setPinUnsigned

        public static void setPinUnsigned(java.lang.String name,
                                  long value)
                           throws NoSuchElementException,
                                  InvalidElementException,
                                  InvalidWidthException,
                                  IllegalValueException
        Set an input bus (multiple pins bundled together as a single unit).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the input pin
        value - the value to be set
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no input pin named (key)
        InvalidElementException - If name is not an input pin
        InvalidWidthException - if the input pin is not wide enough (i.e., does not have enough bits) to represent value
        IllegalValueException - if value is negative

      • readPin

        public static boolean readPin(java.lang.String name)
                       throws NoSuchElementException,
                              InvalidElementException,
                              InvalidWidthException
        Get the value of a single output pin
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the output pin
        Returns:
        true if the pin is set, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no output pin named (name)
        InvalidElementException - If name is not an output pin
        InvalidWidthException - if name is not one bit wide.

      • readPinSigned

        public static long readPinSigned(java.lang.String name)
                          throws NoSuchElementException,
                                 InvalidElementException
        Get the value on pin name as a signed integer (i.e., interpret the most significant bit as a sign bit).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the output pin
        Returns:
        the value on pin name as a signed integer
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no output pin named (name)
        InvalidElementException - If name is not an output pin

      • readPinUnsigned

        public static long readPinUnsigned(java.lang.String name)
                            throws NoSuchElementException,
                                   InvalidElementException
        Get the value on pin name as an unsigned integer.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the output pin
        Returns:
        the value on pin name as an unsigned integer
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no output pin named (name)
        InvalidElementException - If name is not an output pin

      • setRegister

        public static void setRegister(java.lang.String name,
                               boolean value)
                        throws NoSuchElementException,
                               InvalidElementException,
                               InvalidWidthException
        Set a one-bit register. Cannot be used on multi-bit register.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the register
        value - the value to be set (true or false).
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no register named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a register
        InvalidWidthException - If the register does not have width 1.

      • setRegisterSigned

        public static void setRegisterSigned(java.lang.String name,
                                     long value)
                              throws NoSuchElementException,
                                     InvalidElementException,
                                     InvalidWidthException
        Set a register. When using this method, the register must have enough room for a sign bit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the register
        value - the value to be set
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no register named (key)
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a register
        InvalidWidthException - if the register is not wide enough (i.e., does not have enough bits) to represent value

        InvalidElementException - If name is not a register
        InvalidWidthException - if the register is not wide enough (i.e., does not have enough bits) to represent value
        IllegalValueException - if value is negative

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no register named (name)
        InvalidElementException - if name is not a register
        InvalidWidthException - if name is not one bit wide

      • readRegisterSigned

        public static long readRegisterSigned(java.lang.String name)
                               throws NoSuchElementException,
                                      InvalidElementException
        Get the value in register name as a signed integer (i.e., interpret the most significant bit as a sign bit).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the register
        Returns:
        the value on pin name as a signed integer
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if there is no register named (name)
        InvalidElementException - if name is not a register

      • setMemorySigned

        public static void setMemorySigned(java.lang.String name,
                                   int beginningWordAddress,
                                   int[] values)
                            throws NoSuchElementException,
                                   InvalidElementException
        Sets memory
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory.
        beginningWordAddress - word address of the first word to be set
        values - an array of word values to be set. (The entire array will be set.)
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no memory named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a memory

      • setMemorySigned

        public static void setMemorySigned(java.lang.String name,
                                   int beginningWordAddress,
                                   int value)
                            throws NoSuchElementException,
                                   InvalidElementException
        Sets memory
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory.
        beginningWordAddress - word address of the first word to be set
        value - the word value to be set
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no memory named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a memory

      • setMemoryUnsigned

        public static void setMemoryUnsigned(java.lang.String name,
                                     int beginningWordAddress,
                                     int[] values)
                              throws NoSuchElementException,
                                     InvalidElementException
        Sets memory as unsigned (positive) integers
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory.
        beginningWordAddress - word address of the first word to be set
        values - an array of word values to be set. (The entire array will be set.)
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no memory named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a memory

      • setMemoryUnsigned

        public static void setMemoryUnsigned(java.lang.String name,
                                     int beginningWordAddress,
                                     int value)
                              throws NoSuchElementException,
                                     InvalidElementException
        Sets memory as unsigned (positive) integers
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the memory.
        beginningWordAddress - word address of the first word to be set
        value - the value to be set
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If there is no memory named name
        InvalidElementException - If name is not a memory

      • readMemorySigned

        public static long[] readMemorySigned(java.lang.String name,
                                      long start,
                                      int length)
                               throws NoSuchElementException,
                                      InvalidElementException
        Get the values in the memory as signed long integers
        Parameters:
        name - the memory name
        start - the first word address to retrieve
        length - the number of word addresses to retrieve
        Returns:
        the values as signed integers
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a memory named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element

      • readMemorySigned

        public static long readMemorySigned(java.lang.String name,
                                    long address)
                             throws NoSuchElementException,
                                    InvalidElementException
        Get the value in the memory as a signed long integer
        Parameters:
        name - the memory name
        address - the word address to retreive
        Returns:
        the value as a signed integer
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if a memory named name can't be found
        InvalidElementException - if name is not the correct type of element
